changesets.comments: game: fixed 'exceeded MAX_MULTI_SPAWNTARGETS' error, patch by flms and ETPub project, fixes #208
game: reset the remappedShaders data structure on map start refs #208
game: reset the remappedShaders data structure on map start refs #208
game: better debug info for info_limbo_camera_setup refs #208
game: don't drop invalid weapons refs #208
mod: exclude WP_NONE from weapon stats refs #208

mod: don't start to reload invalid weapons (there is no item for) refs
#208, don't cool WP_NONE
game: better debug info for info_limbo_camera_setup refs #208
game: don't drop invalid weapons refs #208
mod: exclude WP_NONE from weapon stats refs #208

mod: don't start to reload invalid weapons (there is no item for) refs
#208, don't cool WP_NONE

journals.notes: That's odd ... the test server we have had some games on is up for more than 48h ... did you run stock maps ?

It happened several times on Goldrush, but I suspect it is related to omnibot (10 bots running), because crash follows immediately after "Omnibot inicialization is complete" log message. I cannot upload server log, because it gets misformatted after some time of running - another new issue. Now I am trying to run empty server and see if it crashes or not.

_EDIT:_ no, happens even with @omnibot_enable = 0@

details.name: description
details.new_value:
ERROR: SP_team_WOLF_objective: exceeded MAX_MULTI_SPAWNTARGETS (16)
MAX_MULTI_SPAWNTARGETS was not changed in ET:L

journals.notes: ETPub has a fix for this. see https://www.assembla.com/code/etpub/subversion/commit/404

crapshoot wrote:
> ETPub has a fix for this. see https://www.assembla.com/code/etpub/subversion/commit/404

Thank you, user:crapshoot! This bug was driving me crazy.
Applied in changeset commit:70d52bc3951566110be9d64b97a05575b6e6c994.

journals.notes:
I did few map <mapname>
I think 1 of maps may be corrupted somehow
It doesn't seem to be map related - it happened so far on goldrush, golddays_v4 and fueldump.

user:IR4T4 added more verbosity to the error message: 
ERROR: G_FindConfigstringIndex: overflow 'textures/cptnt_baseracebeta3/flag_Allied_spawn1' (576 608) max: 32
Server was running fine all night, but when I joined it the next day and voted for baserace desert map this error was thrown upon map change.

It seems the configstring is not populated properly from time to time OR the holding buffer/getter function has issues. When you enter the 'configstrings' cmd several times it also occures it's not fully printed:

I was able to 'reproduce' the crash on the testserver: - start a map and wait until warmup is over - timelimit 0.1 - vote map Just do that several times ... -------------- The configstring command has similar behaviour as our 'crash' cause: The area we are interested in is dropped a lot! 
363: sound/movers/doors/door2_endcq 704: n\[BOT]Nohope\t\1\c\4\r\0\m\0000000\s\0000000\dn\\dr\0\w\10\lw\10\sw\14\mu\0\ref\1

EDIT: hm weird, i first thought that by downgrading my gcc i would be able to circumvent all these fixes, but it seems this is not the case. Basically i have the same problem with an independent source, it messes up the configstring at numspawntargets and reaches MAX_MULTISPAWN_TARGETS after a certain amount of maps.

Anybody has an explanation what is happening here ? I have no problems with the same source on windows. Also it is worth noting that the downgrading of my gcc from v4.6 to 4.4 was working at first. But now it seems something has changed on my system. I only ran a makefile of another build in between :< Did test thouroughly yesterday and today morning and there all worked with v.4.4. So yea, anybody a deeper explanation ? Also: this only happens if i conditionally compile Omnibot into my build. If i exclude it all is fine. Maybe something gets messed up in the linking ? Some functions may not work ? Are there problems when compiling with a really low gcc version, e.g. 3.3 ?

Here we go again. Server running stock maps and 8 omnibots errors out with this @info_limbo_camera@ error after a day or two of uptime.

Server log: http://pastebin.com/QMh27zrM

Our version:2.71rc3 server with custom maps seems to be running without any problems, so I removed the custom maps and restarted the server, because that is the only thing, besides @xpsave.lua@ script and highres flags, that is different between these servers.

*Server 1* (version:2.71rc3, Omni-bot, dynamite.lua, original maps):

    * @etlegacy.com:27960@     

*Server 2* (git version, Omni-bot, dynamite.lua, xpsave.lua, original maps):

    * @etlegacy.com:27961@
I did notice same issue with rc3 but I don't know how to reproduce :/ It happens after days ...

Server number 2 was down again and I had to restart it.

I will recompile it tomorrow, so it includes the recent commits with more debug info and I will add a debug lua script to @lua_modules@ as well.

This ticket is about 3 errors now :-O

In fact WP_NONE has no item - this should be fixed with latest commits.

Radegast, let the Lua script also call svcmd 'game_memory' - I would like to know if there are game memory issues
